title: Pre-populate test credentials on Firebase OTP login screen

requirements.text: In App.tsx, ensure the phone number input field on the Firebase OTP login screen is pre-populated with the value '+911234567890' and the OTP input field is pre-populated with the value '123456' as default values via React state initializers. These test credentials must appear ready-to-use when the login screen loads, without any user interaction.
acceptanceCriteria: When the login screen loads, the phone number input field displays '+911234567890' as its initial value.
When the login screen loads, the OTP input field displays '123456' as its initial value.
The pre-populated values are set via React state initializers (e.g. useState('+911234567890') and useState('123456')), not hardcoded as HTML attributes only.
The Send OTP and Verify buttons continue to function correctly using the pre-populated values.
All existing login/logout/auto-login behavior remains intact.

constraints: Do not change the Firebase OTP authentication flow logic.
Do not modify any files listed in frontend.immutablePaths.
The existing localStorage auto-login (zweetiUser check on mount) and logout function must remain intact.
nonGoals: Modifying the billing UI or any feature outside the login screen.
